text.text_translated:
Millennials are people born between 1983 and 1993.

A company called PwC did a survey around the world. More than 40,000 people answered questions. Some people were millennials and some were not. The survey asked about work culture and how people communicate. It also asked about different ways of working. It asked about pay and how to get a better job. It also asked about the time for work and the time for life.

Another company called Deloitte also did a survey around the world. More than 10,000 millennials answered questions. The survey asked what they think about the difficult world of work. It asked about the dangers and the good chances they see in their jobs.

To improve fidelity, use phrasing that is closer to the original, such as 'what they think about problems and good chances at work' instead of 'dangers and the good chances they see in their jobs'.
